Table of Contents

Interface IRepository<T>

Namespace
NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Interfaces.Repositories
Assembly
NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.dll

Generic repository interface defining standard CRUD, bulk, and query operations for entities in the NeonSuit RSS Reader application.

public interface IRepository<T> where T : class, new()

Type Parameters

T

The entity type. Must be a reference type with a parameterless constructor.

Remarks

All asynchronous methods accept a CancellationToken to support cooperative cancellation and timeout scenarios, especially important in background sync and UI-responsive operations on low-resource hardware.

Read operations default to no-tracking for memory efficiency. Write operations are transactional and support concurrency handling.

Methods

AnyAsync(Expression<Func<T, bool>>, CancellationToken)

Checks if any entity matches the specified predicate.

Task<bool> AnyAsync(Expression<Func<T, bool>> predicate, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

predicate Expression<Func<T, bool>>

Filter expression.

cancellationToken CancellationToken

Token to cancel the operation.

Returns

Task<bool>

True if at least one matching entity exists.

Exceptions

OperationCanceledException

Thrown if the operation is canceled.

Exception

Thrown if a database error occurs.

DeleteAllAsync(CancellationToken)

Deletes all records from the table. Use with extreme caution.

Task<int> DeleteAllAsync(CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

cancellationToken CancellationToken

Token to cancel the operation.

Returns

Task<int>

The number of deleted rows.

Remarks

This is a destructive operation with no undo. Consider soft-delete patterns instead when possible. Uses efficient bulk delete without loading entities into memory.

Exceptions

OperationCanceledException

Thrown if the operation is canceled.

Exception

Thrown if a database error occurs.

DeleteAsync(T, CancellationToken)

Deletes an entity from the database.

Task<int> DeleteAsync(T entity, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

entity T

The entity to delete (must be attached or have a valid primary key).

cancellationToken CancellationToken

Token to cancel the operation.

Returns

Task<int>

The number of affected rows (usually 1).

Exceptions

ArgumentNullException

Thrown when entity is null.

DbUpdateConcurrencyException

Thrown if the entity was already deleted.

OperationCanceledException

Thrown if the operation is canceled.

Exception

Thrown if a database error occurs.

DeleteByIdAsync(int, CancellationToken)

Deletes an entity by its primary key identifier using efficient bulk delete.

Parameters

The primary key value of the entity to delete.

cancellationToken CancellationToken

Token to cancel the operation.

Returns

Task<int>

Exceptions

OperationCanceledException

Thrown if the operation is canceled.

GetAllAsync(CancellationToken)

Retrieves all entities of type T from the database.

Task<List<T>> GetAllAsync(CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

cancellationToken CancellationToken

Token to cancel the operation.

Returns

Task<List<T>>

A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains the list of entities.

Remarks

Use with caution on large tables; prefer filtered/paginated queries when possible.

Exceptions

OperationCanceledException

Thrown if the operation is canceled.

Exception

Thrown if a database error occurs.

GetByIdAsync(int, CancellationToken)

Retrieves a single entity by its primary key identifier.

Parameters

id int

The primary key value.

cancellationToken CancellationToken

Token to cancel the operation.

Returns

Task<T>

The entity if found, otherwise null.

Remarks

This method returns a tracked entity suitable for updates.

Exceptions

Thrown if the operation is canceled.

Exception

Thrown if a database error occurs.

Parameters

The collection of entities to insert.

Token to cancel the operation.

Returns

Task<int>

The number of affected rows.

Remarks

For large collections, consider batching to avoid memory pressure.

OperationCanceledException

Thrown if the operation is canceled.

Exception

Thrown if a database error occurs.

cancellationToken CancellationToken

Token to cancel the operation.

Returns

Task<int>

DbUpdateException

Thrown if the operation is canceled.

Exception

Thrown if a database error occurs.

InsertOrUpdateAsync(T, CancellationToken)

Performs an upsert operation: inserts if the entity does not exist, updates if it does.

Task<int> InsertOrUpdateAsync(T entity, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

entity T

The entity to upsert.

cancellationToken CancellationToken

Token to cancel the operation.

Returns

Task<int>

The number of affected rows.

Exceptions

ArgumentNullException

Thrown when entity is null.

InvalidOperationException

Thrown if the entity type lacks an 'Id' property.

OperationCanceledException

Thrown if the operation is canceled.

Exception

Thrown if a database error occurs.

UpdateAllAsync(IEnumerable<T>, CancellationToken)

Updates multiple entities in a single batch operation.

Task<int> UpdateAllAsync(IEnumerable<T> entities, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

entities IEnumerable<T>

The collection of entities to update.

cancellationToken CancellationToken

Token to cancel the operation.

Returns

Task<int>

The number of affected rows.

Remarks

All entities must have valid primary keys. For large collections, consider batching.

Exceptions

OperationCanceledException

Thrown if the operation is canceled.

Exception

Thrown if a database error occurs.

UpdateAsync(T, CancellationToken)

Updates an existing entity in the database.

Task<int> UpdateAsync(T entity, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

entity T

The entity with updated values (must have a valid primary key).

cancellationToken CancellationToken

Token to cancel the operation.

Returns

Task<int>

The number of affected rows (usually 1).

Exceptions

ArgumentNullException

Thrown when entity is null.

DbUpdateConcurrencyException

Thrown if the entity was modified by another user.

OperationCanceledException

Thrown if the operation is canceled.

Exception

Thrown if a database error occurs.
